awd_titl_txt: Towards a Comprehensive Model for the Origin of the Irish   Ore Deposits:  A Stable Isotope, Heavy Isotope, REE Fluid   Inclusion and Petrologic Study
awd_abstract_narration: Continued research is proposed on MVT type Zn-Pb ore deposits              in Ireland.  These deposits are related by common metal sources in              underlying metasediments and a regional hydrothermal plumbing                   system controlled by large fault systems.  Further research goals               address:  (1) the chemistry and isotopic characteristics of the                 metal-rich fluid, (2) the cause of oxidation of metasediments                   underlying major ore deposits (i.e. is this related to reduction                of sea water sulfate?), (3) geographic controls on sulfur isotope               chemistry in locally-derived sulfur-rich fluids.  Specific                      objectives include (1) mineralogic, fluid inclusion, and isotope                studies of feeder veins, (2) background studies of unaltered meta-              sediments to evaluate alteration associated with mineralization,                (3) detailed studies of oxidized metasediments to characterize the              alteration fluids.

inst.inst_name: Columbia University Lamont Doherty Earth Observatory
